name: SoHo Metropolitan

reviews.text: I am from Toronto and we decided to spend a few days R & R downtown and be pampered.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but........

reviews.text: The room at the SOHO was beutiful and the bathroom was very impressive. Room service came in (it seemed) everytime we left our room and cleaned it.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel - Highly Recommended
Outstanding Hotel
reviews.text: But there were a few little things wrong, which for the price supprised me.
They said the rooms all had surround sound.. Ours did not. The tv was not plasma.
reviews.title: I felt like a rock star except for the lousy housekeeping!

reviews.text: The central controls for the lights did not work.
reviews.title: We'd stay there again, but you should know...

reviews.text: I can't say enough about the high quality of this hotel. My company's travel agency booked me here on a recent business trip. The rooms are huge, with luxurious bathroom and vast closet space. There is a comfortable couch facing the TV. The lighting in the rooms is excellent for work and reading. High-speed internet connection is free--perfect for the business traveler. An excellent healthy breakfast buffet is available in the cafe. Best of all, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The concierge even followed me to the front door to wave good-bye and wish me a safe flight home!
reviews.title: A great hotel

likes.liked: — Comfortable bed and excellent lighting in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on reviews here, and we were very happy with our room. Stayed in a luxury room on the 4th floor and didn't notice any street noise. The front desk and concierge service was solid and friendly, no matter who was working. We didn't eat there as there was a Cora's across the street and we ate breakfast there. Try Jump down the street for dinner. It was a bit expensive but a very good choice, in a good location, and there always seemed to be taxis waiting outside. There was a drugstore nearby for necessities and water. The marble bathroom had a heated floor and we loved it. We will stay here again.
reviews.title: Great luxury bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were married on October 1st and we wanted to stay at a nice hotel after the reception was over. We wanted to splurge on a nice hotel room for one night, so after intense researching we booked a night at the Soho. Well, we couldn't have made a better choice. We arrived at 1am and were greeted by friendly front desk staff who treated us with courtesy. The front desk gentleman upgraded us to a suite and gave us a late checkout. He also insisted on parking our rental car himself. As for the hotel room itself, we were given seasonal fruit and a complimentary bottle of champagne. The room was spectacular; it was well decorated, it had a plasma tv, a safe, writing desk and smart furniture. The bedroom very comfortable which made for a great night's sleep after such a busy day. The bathroom was beautiful. It had a large bath tub or a glass enclosed shower. It was wel lit and was covered in marble. We found the heated floors to be very nice, too.
reviews.title: the SoHo was great

likes.disliked: — The view was not the greatest

reviews.text: Is the SoHo expensive? Yes, but it is definitely worth it. The staff is friendly and professional and will always greet you with a smile. We definitely recommend the SoHo and we would go there again.
reviews.title: Amazing staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me tell you ... the staff in this hotel are amazing. The most amazing concierge I have ever had was Lisa. She was so attentive to every need I had and made fabulous recommendation to the trendy clubs and to some restaurants that I would have never discovered as they were not yet listed in my travel guides. I feel like I would have missed out if it had not have been for Lisa. She went above and beyond what I expected and was the most real and friendly concierge I have ever met. I am a member of Quintessentially and she ranks highest among this luxury service of global concierges that I have ever come across. Absolutely an amazing time at the Soho because of staff like Lisa. Kudos and next time I am in the city I will be once again staying at the Soho and hope that the staff remain at this high caliber. Thank you.
reviews.title: A great stay, excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked this hotel, it made a nice change from staying in big chains, with much more personal service. We stayed twice, either side of visiting Niagara Falls, and requested the same room for the second stay [which they gave us] as it was quiet - I think that some rooms street side could suffer from late night noise. We particularly liked the separate dressing area and big, luxurious bathroom. We ate one eveing meal in the restaurant, which was good but a bit pricey [the chef came round to see how all liked the food, and I noticed him going off to do some requested special orders from other guests after - presumably at additional cost mind you, but again very personal service]. The buffet breakfast may not be the biggest, but has a good selection and is exceptionally good value for quality- half the cost we predicted. I have rated this wholly on the hotel as I thought this excellent, with very helpful staff. I was not quite so struck on the location, a bit of a walk to anywhere we really wanted to go, either central or by the water, but I thought the city quite sprawling anyway, so location could almost be an issue anywhere I would imagine if you want to see it all. Overall we were really happy with this choice of hotel
reviews.title: Loved the hotel but location not the best

reviews.text: What a nice treat to stay in a hotel with an incredible bakery onsite! Being a Vancouverite I am familiar with Senses and Thomas Hass pastries, so I made a point of having my breakfast in Senses every morning. I must say however, the baristas in the Vancouver location make better lattes!
reviews.title: Senses! My hips are wider from having croissants every morning there...

likes.disliked: — design was boring, middle of the road and too safe for a boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay about the hotel... great staff, everyone was warm and welcoming, always tried to anticipate my needs before I even asked and they were very classy. I know they're marketing this hotel as a boutique hotel but somehow I didn't get that feel. It's hard to peg why I felt that way, maybe it's the long corridor to get to the room, long walks to the room always makes me think of a convention hotel. The rooms were decorated in a clean contemporary style but nothing that left an impression. It made me giggle when I saw picture frames decorated in rooms with the original generic picture left inside (b/w picture of a stylish woman and on the bottom said "umbra"!). Not a "boutique" touch don't you think? This is such a small detail but I had to add that! Molton Brown oatmeal soap was very nice, the shampoo and conditioner had a very masculine smell so I ended up using my back-up shampoo.
reviews.title: Loved the Atmosphere and Decor!

reviews.text: I would stay at SoHo again on business but then there are many other hotels in Toronto to choose from at this cost. They need something extra to capture my loyalty.
reviews.title: a quality, well run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the SoHo. It was decorated exactly how I would decorate my own home...clean, modern, but warm and comfortable. Check in was easy, parking was simple, and the room exceeded our expectations. I am one PICKY customer, so that was a nice surprise. The bathroom was my favourite....heated marble, spotless, the remote control curtains, maid service, etc...everything was great, except their Restaurant Senses. It was rated well, so we were excited to have a fabulous meal. They no longer have a tasting menu as advertised, they were out of the two dishes I wanted to order, and when my husband ordered a port, they gave him the wrong one, and then tried to argue over it. Not good for a $375 plus meal for 2.
reviews.title: Soho Met.. You rock!

reviews.text: I stayed in the SoHo while on a business trip as they were having a special that made it cheaper than the Royal York (where I usually stay when in town).
reviews.title: SoHo - Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.text: The SoHo is one block north of Front Street on the western side of the downtown core. It was a nice 10 minute walk to get to Bay and Yonge where my meetings were (as opposed to a 3 or 4 minute walk from the Royal York). What I love about the SoHo however, is that it is a smallish hotel, no where near the size of the Royal York and because of that there was much more personalized attention. After I checked in, I went across the street to Wayne Gretzky's bar to have a beer while I watched the hockey game and when I came back the concierge greeted me by name - which is the sort of personalized touch that is so great with a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Location, location...but no view
Fantastic
reviews.text: The restaurant in the hotel (Senses?) was very good if not a bit pricey, especially if you are not on an expense account. The mix of people in the hotel seemed to be business travellers, youngish "hipsters" and Europeans (met a nice guy from Paris who was in town with his girlfriend on business). No kids evident.

The rooms were larger than I would expect and the bathrooms were amazing, so far above Royal York level I couldn't even compare them - huge walk-in with a heated floor and top notch toiletries. The bed linen was great (easily compares to Westin/Hyatt level of beds) and I liked the novelty of the auto-blinds.
reviews.title: Less expensive Luxury

reviews.text: As has been noted in previous reviews, my view (I was on the 6th floor I think) was of a building under-construction, but which appeared to be close to completion - looks like a condo. I was never bothered by any noise. This area is a very trendy with lots of high end condos around. There is a parking lot adjacent as well. Reading through the reviews, I am surprised to see no one commented on the great night-time views of the big building lights. I quite liked that.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel, and close to restaurants and bars..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay at the Soho Met during our vacation to Toronto - my husband does not do high rise hotels and the Met was the perfect find. It did not disappoint!!
reviews.title: Pure Indulgence

likes.liked: — Size of the rooms, and the luxurious bathrooms
likes.disliked: — Privacy screen on window - a bit tricky to get right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Admittedly more pricey than most of the rest, but in terms of luxury and location, you cannot beat it.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Live in New York and have lived in Dallas so i was encouraged by some of the other reviews posted, comparing this dump to some amazing properties like the Mansion in Dallas.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE

reviews.text: I was supposed to stay here for 10 days but I finally gave up on the horrible location, lousy service and cheap pretend furniture, and left after 4 days. At the begginning of the week, the area is a ghost town. Other than a couple of pubs, there is nothing here. As bad as that is, come Thursday I regretted my complaints. On Thursday this club location turns into a loud-kids only -hang out. Mobs of kids, shootings etc. Bring A bullet proof vest and ear plugs. I finally gave up and left on Friday.
reviews.title: Definitely THE BEST

likes.liked: — The hotel is stylish and comfortable
likes.disliked: — The service at the bakery wasn't very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious but furnished from a cheap bargain store. Scratches and chips everywhere. Linen, while nice at some previous point, were bear and some even had stains. Room service??? Now there was a joke. It basically did not exist, and the one time it did arrive within an hour of ordering, the fries were soggy, and the salad was wilted.
reviews.title: Top Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I tried to complain, I just got a run around and some condesending results, suggesting that Bloor St is more my location. So I took their advice and moved to one of the Hotels in that area and had an absolutely amazing time. Toronto is GREAT but the SOHO MET is a DUMP. I am inb my 40's, so maybe I have been around too long to know when to move on, and I did OUT of the SOHO. And so should anyoneone else that is unfortunate enough to have booked here.
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway Hotel - Highly Recommended

likes.disliked: — Sign up for the Preferred Guest program online. Gets you free upgrades!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Soho two times and each time was lovely. My most recent visit was over New Year's Eve weekend. (My husband and I were suprised to see some of the same staff who had been there over a year earlier still working there ). The rooms are great & spacious. The linens are nice, the bath products are nice and the large tubs are great for taking relaxing bubble baths. The only thing we though was odd is that the televisions seem to be old and clunky. They don't really fit in with the modern and sleek decor.
reviews.title: Not Luxurious as stated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 8 nights here recently. A few issues with the room, but they were quickly ironed out by the manager after a quiet word - blown bulbs, housekeeping issues - nothing major, but in this price range defiantly worth mentioning.
reviews.title: Laid back and funky

likes.disliked: — A bit out of the way of downtown

reviews.text: The location is fine - not the best, it's on a busy intersection of roads right by the Rogers Centre, it gets very busy before and after events there, as well as Fri/Sat evenings.
reviews.title: Sleek, luxe choice
Very Good but our stay was ruined by noise
reviews.text: Reception staff were attentive and efficient. The bar has a very Malmaison look about it - all dark browns and reds and candles etc.

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.text: We did not eat here in the evening (and neither should you - get out and sample the foodie heaven that is Toronto!) but we did have breakfast here on our first day, before we knew better. It was overpriced and not good value - maybe the chef had an off day, but the meals were just chucked on the plate, burnt eggs etc (breakfast tip - we also joined the queue outside Cora’s - but do not - it's another wasted effort, the breakfasts consist of things like Eggs Benedict with water melon and star fruit - just wrong!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice gym - compact but lots of kit, also the pool is small but perfectly formed, and there's a big whirlpool bath right next to it.
reviews.title: Modern, sleek luxury

likes.liked: — Luxurious, sleek and modern; excellent service

reviews.title: Outstanding!!!!!!
reviews.text: My partner and I were desperate for a place to stay after a horrible night in another hotel the night before. We called the SoHo Met and they were reasonably priced so we moved there. This place exceeded our expectations!!! We stayed in the long term self-contained apartment accommodation side of the hotel (stays of longer than 7 days) and we loved it. The bed and bathroom were out of this world and the room came with internet access and computer (for a small extra charge) We had access to the gym and pool which was also great. This is one of the best places I have ever stayed - would recommend without a second thought!!!!

I stayed in the SoHo from Dec. 24-28 and now have a favorite hotel! Previously I had thought no one could match the service and amenities of a Rosewood Hotel (see Hotel Crescent Court or Mansion on Turtle Creek in Dallas) but the SoHo exceeded their high standards. The property is beautiful and just the right size for a personal feel for each guest, but maintaining the granduer of a special hotel experience. The rooms are very large and the walk in closet configuration should be adopted by more hotels along with the ample bathrooms. Senses is a great restaurant and though a little more than Cora's across the street the breakfast buffet is worth it. Of course the deserts are great and just right for a late night treat! But the best part of the hotel were the peolpe - On Christmas day there were only 18 guest in the hotel, but everything was fully staffed and extra efforts were made to accomadate us on the holiday. From locating a movie theater and show times for us, to enjoyable conversation in the bar - the staff was a true joy. Everyone made the effort to know you on a first name basis and it was not pretencious - but seemed genuine. I cannot say enough - if staying in Toronto, there is no match to the SoHo.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in North America

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location, unlike the Yorkville hotels where you have to take a cab or subway to get downtown. The Soho is close to Toronto's finest restaurants and hottest night clubs and a short walk to the Theater district which came in handy during Toronto's cold weather.
reviews.title: Excellent Location
Wrong neighbourhood, below expectations.
reviews.text: The rooms were breathtaking with curtains that closed with a flick of a switch and heated marble bathroom floors. Staff was help full and showed me how the gadgets in the room worked. The Soho has great package deals during the weekends I would definitely stay here again. I just hope they get rid of the paper coffee cups in the rooom!

reviews.title: nice stay at the Soho Met
reviews.text: This hotel is too upmarket for where it is, it should be located in Yorkville. The rooms are visually appealing, but forget a nice view! The website should really disclose that on the picture of the building, that the above floors are for residential apartments, and low section is where your room wil be, it creates some false hope. Didn't like the service, they had the "Abercrombie & Fitch" mentality... which is when staff think they are so "hot" for working somewhere that they act too good to the customer. Stay at the Park Hyatt or the Four Seasons... this place isn't worth the trip downtown.

description: The SoHo Metropolitan Hotel is simply Toronto's finest, whether you call it a luxury, boutique or design hotel. At once supremely indulgent and artfully subdued, the hotel affectionately dubbed "SoHo Met" is a vibrant scene unto itself. From inspired culinary creations and rejuvenating spa treatments to advanced in-room technologies and innovative business services, a limitless range of sophisticated pleasures awaits you. Whether you are staying for just a weekend or weeks on end, you will quickly realize that one does more than stay at the SoHo Met ... one lives it. The moment you set foot upon the marble floors of the SoHo Metropolitan Hotel in Toronto, you enter a world of exquisite delights and unparalleled convenience, where the hotel's commitment to service and personal attention exceed all expectations. The three story, loft-style penthouse suite and 92 oversized, luxurious guestrooms and suites represent the very epitome of SoHo Metropolitan style. European natural down duvets and triple Italian bed linens grace the luxurious king-size beds. When it's time to say good night, use the smart technology to adjust lighting, motorized draperies and do-not-disturb light.
